column3: The entire story is on auto-play
column4: from what I can tell there is no way to pause the story from progressing. Even toggling to one of the menu options has no effect
column5: the story keeps going even when you are not watching . The gameplay only stops when your character has to make a choice
column6: this makes it difficult to enjoy. There are distractions in life and being able to pause in a text based novel seems like a feature that's a must.

column3: Good game
column4: but overrated. As someone who read a lot of light novels
column5: its story is actualy pretty good. Artwork and presentation are neat. Music is nice but too few so its repeatitive. Story branching is not that impressive compare to other LN Ive played. Gameplay is also way too short. Shouldve added more dead end route so it feels like its actually a game not an ebook. Still
column6: this game is worth trying if you are into games with good story.

Underworld Office is billed as a chat-style interactive storytelling game
column4: so it's basically a choose-your-own-adventure with branching paths. This kind of setup allows for a fair bit of replayability if you'd like to see all of the game's endings
column5: and thanks to a few collectible items
column6: there's more than one reason to replay. It also doesn't hurt that the title offers a heartfelt story
column7: so it should easily keep players coming back for a bit. This game is on sale and it's definitely worth it.

column6: I can relate easily
column7: and made me sure that this visual novel indirectly has something else in mind other than entertainment
column8: to help us reflect upon ourselves. Wish there's a sequel too. Definitely a buy

column3: Okay so i'll be honest. This game is very refreshing in the visual novel genre. I have played visual interactive novels before and their choices didn't do anything other than have 3 endings achievable by "intimacy points" earned in the choices. This one is different
column4: whatever choice you make would literally alter your path
column5: change the people you meet or go with
column6: and i think that's pretty cool. Those who rated 1 star mostly just bought this game on accident and wanted a refund.

column3: Very beautiful game🥺 I normally don't play much interactive games because of how much microtransactions they give but this game was worth the money I spent on it. Firstly it wasn't at all expensive and such a beautiful story. If you like supernatural genre plots go for it and another reason I really really love this is THE CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT is freaking touching and beautifully written with carefully animated scenes.
